title: Unable to get Besu syncing, Teku is supposedly syncing
body:
Just tried to get besu and teku up. Got the node running used the latest versions and followed the tutorial. Desu is stalled with the following logs

```
Nov 17 01:10:55 besu[1181919]: 2022-11-17 01:10:55.708+00:00 | main | INFO  | PeerDiscoveryAgent | Starting peer discovery agent on host=0.0.0.0, port=30303
Nov 17 01:10:55 besu[1181919]: 2022-11-17 01:10:55.891+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-1 | INFO  | VertxPeerDiscoveryAgent | Started peer discovery agent successfully, on effective host=0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0%0 and port=30303
Nov 17 01:10:55 besu[1181919]: 2022-11-17 01:10:55.894+00:00 | main | INFO  | PeerDiscoveryAgent | P2P peer discovery agent started and listening on /0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0%0:30303
Nov 17 01:10:56 besu[1181919]: 2022-11-17 01:10:56.210+00:00 | main | INFO  | PeerDiscoveryAgent | Writing node record to disk. NodeRecord{seq=4, publicKey=0x0258311809d1f120dfa9f985bfbd840931903d56654fab0df1c42a7c496364fed7, udpAddress=Optional[/127.0.0.1:30303], tcpAddress=Optional[/127.0.0.1:30303], asBase64=-Jq4QF26r02XYBOHhXybolX_6HSG_-I2bK0tqp65DM35Ip49cb-hRtQIVTo0stOWzmjqx2WJyD0UC39YsXU-NZqoRq0Eg2V0aMrJhKP1qwiDF9QzgmlkgnY0gmlwhH8AAAGJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQJYMRgJ0fEg36n5hb-9hAkxkD1WZU-rDfHEKnxJY2T-14N0Y3CCdl-DdWRwgnZf, nodeId=0xcf1073a9b9c2db06d3cbe35783fe915dc33a2721d345a75ef7e9260f613b0dcb, customFields={tcp=30303, udp=30303, ip=0x7f000001, eth=[[0xa3f5ab08, 0x17d433]], id=V4, secp256k1=0x0258311809d1f120dfa9f985bfbd840931903d56654fab0df1c42a7c496364fed7}}
Nov 17 01:10:56 besu[1181919]: 2022-11-17 01:10:56.446+00:00 | main | INFO  | DefaultP2PNetwork | Enode URL enode://58311809d1f120dfa9f985bfbd840931903d56654fab0df1c42a7c496364fed7ce04f5376dca12893a086966b77d6fd8dfbf105ae940e13d8bade97981e92098@127.0.0.1:30303
Nov 17 01:10:56  besu[1181919]: 2022-11-17 01:10:56.532+00:00 | main | INFO  | DefaultP2PNetwork | Node address 0x83fe915dc33a2721d345a75ef7e9260f613b0dcb
Nov 17 01:10:56  besu[1181919]: 2022-11-17 01:10:56.551+00:00 | main | INFO  | DefaultSynchronizer | Starting synchronizer.
Nov 17 01:10:56 besu[1181919]: 2022-11-17 01:10:56.571+00:00 | main | INFO  | FastSyncDownloader | Starting sync
Nov 17 01:10:56 besu[1181919]: 2022-11-17 01:10:56.598+00:00 | main | INFO  | Runner | Ethereum main loop is up.
Nov 17 01:11:00 besu[1181919]: 2022-11-17 01:11:00.027+00:00 | Timer-0 | INFO  | DNSResolver | Resolved 426 nodes
```

Teku is syncing according to slots

```
Nov 17 01:27:25 teku[1181856]: 01:27:25.275 INFO  - Syncing     *** Target slot: 4345037, Head slot: 14037, Remaining slots: 4331000, Connected peers: 3
Nov 17 01:27:37 teku[1181856]: 01:27:37.888 INFO  - Syncing     *** Target slot: 4345038, Head slot: 14049, Remaining slots: 4330989, Connected peers: 3
Nov 17 01:27:48 teku[1181856]: 01:27:48.430 INFO  - Syncing     *** Target slot: 4345039, Head slot: 14069, Remaining slots: 4330970, Connected peers: 2
Nov 17 01:28:02 i teku[1181856]: 01:28:02.222 INFO  - Syncing     *** Target slot: 4345040, Head slot: 14087, Remaining slots: 4330953, Connected peers: 2
Nov 17 01:28:12 i teku[1181856]: 01:28:12.968 INFO  - Syncing     *** Target slot: 4345041, Head slot: 14104, Remaining slots: 4330937, Connected peers: 6
Nov 17 01:28:24 i teku[1181856]: 01:28:24.201 INFO  - Syncing     *** Target slot: 4345042, Head slot: 14121, Remaining slots: 4330921, Connected peers: 5
Nov 17 01:28:37 i teku[1181856]: 01:28:37.335 INFO  - Syncing     *** Target slot: 4345043, Head slot: 14139, Remaining slots: 4330904, Connected peers: 5
Nov 17 01:28:48  teku[1181856]: 01:28:48.001 INFO  - Syncing     *** Target slot: 4345044, Head slot: 14154, Remaining slots: 4330890, Connected peers: 5
Nov 17 01:29:02  teku[1181856]: 01:29:02.093 INFO  - Syncing     *** Target slot: 4345045, Head slot: 14175, Remaining slots: 4330870, Connected peers: 4
Nov 17 01:29:12 teku[1181856]: 01:29:12.018 INFO  - Syncing     *** Target slot: 4345046, Head slot: 14191, Remaining slots: 4330855, Connected peers: 3
```

However my Besu is not syncing at all. How do i get Besu syncing? I was previously running Geth and Prysm on this EC2 instance. Unsure if that has anything to do with it.

You appear to be syncing Teku from genesis which isn't recommended. Since it hasn't yet reached the merge, Besu (or any EL) is unable to begin syncing as it requires the CL to tell it what the chain head is.

Unless you specifically need an archive beacon node with all historic states (in which case you'll just have to wait), you should stop teku, add an `--initial-state` param to teku pointing to one of the state providers from https://eth-clients.github.io/checkpoint-sync-endpoints/ delete the existing Teku database and then start Teku again so it can do a checkpoint sync.  Teku will then be in sync with the beacon chain within a couple of minutes and will be able to keep Besu up to date with the information on the current chain head it needs to sync.

> You appear to be syncing Teku from genesis which isn't recommended. Since it hasn't yet reached the merge, Besu (or any EL) is unable to begin syncing as it requires the CL to tell it what the chain head is.
> 
> Unless you specifically need an archive beacon node with all historic states (in which case you'll just have to wait), you should stop teku, add an `--initial-state` param to teku pointing to one of the state providers from https://eth-clients.github.io/checkpoint-sync-endpoints/ delete the existing Teku database and then start Teku again so it can do a checkpoint sync. Teku will then be in sync with the beacon chain within a couple of minutes and will be able to keep Besu up to date with the information on the current chain head it needs to sync.

Thank you very much, I do not need an archive node atm, ie. traces/logs, since those eat up like 11TB of space and i don't feel the need for it just yet.
Looks like i am trouble getting the latest block for some reason with besu and teku unfortunately. Will try and investigate it a bit more
@FahdW have you managed to get teku to start from a intial-state? After that you should be fine to get besu syncing. Let us know if you need any further help.
It synced well, but I had another issue when using web3.py it would return the result of latest block number as 0. However my curl route returns the right number
closing for now - please re-open if needed.
